I have been a support worker for 2 years now at Centre 404. But have worked in the area of supporting people with learning disabilities for over 10 years. This is the best organisation I have been in by far. I received a proper and quite lengthy 2-day induction which was not done very well at my last 2 jobs. Everyone is friendly from the CEO to the cleaner which is always a good thing. People there seem to work hard and there is a real commitment to the service users and families.   They held a nice Xmas party for staff which was fun. It is always nice to meet other work mates in a social setting.
cons: It would be good to meet staff from other services.So I guess more events like the Christmas party.Not sure how practical this would be as it is a busy charity with a lot going on.

pros:
I have worked at C404 for more than 10 years.  Why have I stayed? Because I feel listened to, involved in decision making, I can see my role makes a difference, I have a good sense of autonomy in my role, the working culture is good, there is a strong sense of values, the atmosphere is great and if I have a problem or something isn't working right, I know if I talk to someone about it they will listen and try to help resolve it. 
Service users and family carers are genuinely at the heart of everything.
cons: Personally for me, the downsides are what keep it interesting too! Money and resources are always a challenge so how can we be creative, make more of what we have, develop etc.

review_title: Feels like a close family unit that sees you through the hard times and the good
pros: Centre 404 is a lovely organisation to work for. The housing office, which I am most familiar with, is a welcoming and tight-knit environment to work within, where you know everyone has genuinely got your back. There is a culture of honesty and integrity, which permeates through all levels of the organisation. If you are someone who values honesty and equality then you will find a great home within Centre 404. The senior management team collectively has a wealth of knowledge and experience they are only too happy to share. Centre 404 is an organisation that truly supports employee growth and development. It provides a high degree of training and the opportunity to progress within the company. I started out as a support worker before gradually rising up through the ranks to take on the management of two supported houses.  As a manager, it can be tough dealing with the day to day lives of some of the most vulnerable people in our society. Culturally, it is not always a job that is recognised or valued as it should be, but the supportive team which make up the organisation are some of the kindest, generous and passionate people you'll ever meet. Their humour, dedication and dogged determination in delivering high-quality, person-centred support are both inspirational and exemplary.
cons:
Striking that harmonious chord between a good work-life balance is tricky in any workplace and especially when you are working in the care sector. However, Centre 404 has a generous holiday entitlement package and a good internal structure, which enables and encourages responsibility sharing. 

It can be a stressful environment to work within given the complications of the people you support. However, Centre 404 provide their employees with access to a free telephone counselling service in addition to robust and regular person-centred supervision.
